channel.title: Sport | Mail Online
channel.description: Explore MailOnline's latest sport news including football, F1, rugby, NFL and more! Sign up for newsletters to get breaking news delivered to your inbox.

item.title: England Nations League matches to be aired on Channel 4 as broadcaster wins rights for tournament
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Channel 4 has won the battle to broadcast England's Nations League matches this summer.
item.media:credit: Xinhua/REX / Getty Images / POOL/AFP via Getty Images

item.title: Emma Raducanu crashes out of Stuttgart Open following straight-sets defeat by world No 1 Iga Swiatek
item.description: In only her fifth senior match on clay, Raducanu took her to 6-4 6-4 in an encounter that was closer than predicted, despite teenager needing treatment during the second set.

item.title: Liverpool's Sadio Mane is a world-class talent who doesn't get enough credit, says Micah Richards
item.description: MICAH RICHARDS: The first time I saw Sadio Mane was during one of the proudest days of my career. At the 2012 Olympic Games, I was part of Great Britain's football team.
item.media:credit: Andy Hooper/Daily Mail / Liverpool FC via Getty Images / The FA via Getty Images / AFP via Getty Images

item.title: Everton, Leeds or Burnley to go down?Sportsmail predicts each team's results and who faces the drop
item.description: The Claret's 2-0 win over Southampton and the manner of the triumph on Thursday, hauled Everton and Leeds back into the battle to avoid the drop. So who faces the drop? Sportsmail predicts...
item.media:credit: Simon Dael/Shutterstock / Getty Images / PA / Action Images via Reuters / REUTERS

item.title: Harry Maguire 'is set to be DROPPED' for Manchester United's season-defining trip to Arsenal
item.description: The Red Devils travel to the Emirates on Saturday for a season-defining clash with Arsenal which could go a long way to deciding which will grab fourth spot and Champions League football for next season.

item.title: Mercedes endure another poor day as they fail to make it to Q3 for the first time in 10 years
item.description: Mercedes have endured a tough start to the new season and their fortunes did not turn in qualifying for the sprint race at the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix as they failed to make it to Q3.

item.title: IPL: Jos Buttler smashes another hundred for Rajasthan Royals as he eyes Virat Kohli's run record
item.description: Jos Buttler crunched yet another hundred on Friday to take his incredible year in Twenty20 cricket to another level.

item.title: Dietmar Hamann insists Borussia Dortmund will be better without superstar striker Erling Haaland
item.description: Former City, Liverpool and Bayern Munich midfielder Hamann says the deal will suit both parties and Dortmund will continue to score goals even if Haaland leaves this summer.

item.title: EA Sports completely exclude Chelsea players from their Premier League Team of the Season shortlist
item.description: Fans around the world can now cast their votes for their best Premier League XI of the season, with the team announced and released in-game at 6pm on 6 May.

item.title: Erik ten Hag lays down the gauntlet to Cristiano Ronaldo and Co after being named Man United boss
item.description: The Dutchman was confirmed as United's next permanent manager on Thursday and will replace interim boss Ralf Rangnick after agreeing a contract until 2025 worth £9million per year.
item.media:credit: Action Images via Reuters / REUTERS / PA / Getty Images

item.title: Man Utd: Hannibal Mejbri should NOT be praised for 'excitable cameo' in Liverpool loss, says Savage
item.description: Manchester United youngster Hannibal Mejbri did not deserve praise from Gary Neville for his 'excitable cameo' in Tuesday's 4-0 defeat at Liverpool, says Robbie Savage.

item.title: World Snooker Championship: Pigeon interrupts second round fixtures by landing on table at Crucible
item.description: A pigeon incredibly brought the World Snooker Championship to a halt on Friday by finding its way into Sheffield's Crucible Theatre and perching itself on a table.

item.title: Laura Kenny, 29, reveals she suffered a miscarriage last year
item.description: The Olympic gold medallist, 29, who shares son Albie, four, with her Olympian husband Jason, 34, also revealed that she had one of her fallopian due to an ectopic pregnancy.

item.title: Tyson Fury vs Dillian Whyte predictions: Anthony Joshua, Ricky Hatton and more have their say
item.description: The general consensus is that Whyte's only chance is a surprise knockout as Fury comes in as the heavy favourite. Here, Sportsmail brings you predcitions from boxing's biggest names.
item.media:credit: Top Rank via Getty Images / PA / Action Images via Reuters / Getty Images / Mark Robinson / Philip Sharkey/TGS Photo/Shutterstock

item.title: Hayes calls on women's football for a 'bigger push' towards selling out Wembley for the Cup final
item.description: The record crowd for a women's FA Cup final stands at 45,423 while 40,942 attended December's delayed final, which saw Chelsea defeat Arsenal 3-0.
item.media:credit: AP / The FA via Getty Images / AFP via Getty Images

item.title: Charles Leclerc is 'fully focused' on Emilia Romagna Grand Prix despite having watch stolen
item.description: Ferrari driver Charles Leclerc says he's 'fully focused' on the Emilia Romagna Grand Prix this weekend despite recently being a victim of robbery.

item.title: Ukraine needs Premier League clubs to follow PSG and Barcelona and play Dynamo Kyiv on goodwill tour
item.description: Ukraine needs Britain's iconic football clubs to follow the lead set by other famous teams across Europe to set up fixtures with Dynamo Kyiv in the 'Match for Peace!' series, writes Mark Temnycky.

item.title: Declan Rice 'turns down THIRD contract offer' and is 'open' to a move from West Ham
item.description: The 23-year-old England international is set to be one of the most sought-after players in the summer transfer window but West Ham have reportedly set a £150million price tag.

item.title: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang joins elite company at Barcelona after scoring ninth LaLiga goal
item.description: Not only did Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang's goal against Real Sociedad on Thursday earn Barcelona three vital points, it also placed him alongside some elite company.

item.title: Pep Guardiola congratulates 'top class' Erik ten Hag on landing manager's job at rivals Man United
item.description: After months of speculation, Ten Hag's appointment as United boss was yesterday confirmed on a three-year deal at the Manchester club.
item.media:credit: Imago/PA Images / Manchester City FC via Getty Ima

item.title: Barca's Gerard Pique shared recording PSG's Sergio Ramos in latest Spanish football leaks saga
item.description: The latest extraordinary episode in Spanish football concerns a leaked conversation between Sergio Ramos and Gerard Pique, over the power struggles in the national game.
item.media:credit: Irina R Hipolito/Shutterstock / EPA / Getty Images

item.title: Furious Derby County fans savage the club's administrators for billing £2.1M
item.description: Quantuma have revealed their charges are higher than expected, during an administration process which has now dragged on for seven months, as preferred bidder Chris Kirchner files paperwork.

item.title: Pep Guardiola has denied claims that he gave Roy Hodgson the cold shoulder back in 2018
item.description: Hodgson, whose side face Guardiola's Manchester City on Saturday, said he was snubbed by the Spaniard after his Crystal Palace side won 3-2 at the Etihad Stadium in 2018.

item.title: Dwight McNeil and James Tarkowski earn fan £9,450 after outlandish Burnley bet against Southampton
item.description: A punter earned almost £10,000 after winning a remarkable bet in the last few minutes of Burnley's 2-0 win over Southampton thanks to Dwight McNeil's final touch of the ball before he was substituted.

item.title: How long will Erik ten Hag need to restore success to Manchester United?
item.description: The Dutch coach will be the Old Trafford club's next permanent manager, seeking to arrest almost a decade of decline at England's biggest club following Sir Alex Ferguson's retirement.
item.media:credit: Simon Stacpoole / Offside / Sky Sports News

item.title: Brendan Rodgers confirms Jamie Vardy is fit again after recovering from a knee injury
item.description: The 35-year-old's comeback comes at a crucial time, with the Foxes facing Roma in their Europa Conference League semi-final first leg next week.

item.title: Manchester United fans bid 'good riddance' to Paul Pogba after Frenchman is ruled out for the season
item.description: It is safe to say that Manchester United fans are not too disappointed by the news that Paul Pogba is unlikely to play for the club again after the extent of his calf injury was confirmed.
item.media:credit: Liverpool FC via Getty Images / AFP via Getty Images

item.title: West Ham are facing an injury CRISIS ahead of their trip to Chelsea as Issa Diop is latest ruled out
item.description: French defender Issa Diop has joined Kurt Zouma and long-term absentee Angelo Ogbonna on the sidelines, leaving Craig Dawson as the club's only recognised centre-back.
item.media:credit: REUTERS / Simon Dael/Shutterstock / CameraSport via Getty Images / Action Images via Reuters / Getty Images

item.title: John Fury tells David Haye to stay away from Tyson Fury's world title fight against Dillian Whyte
item.description: Haye has backed Whyte to pull off the upset against the heavily favoured Fury, leaving Tyson's father furious at the BT Sport pundit. He has called for Haye to stay away from the event.

item.title: Man United: Erik ten Hag is the ninth Dutch manager in the Premier League - how did the others fare?
item.description: The 52-year-old faces an almighty task but unluckily for both United and Ten Hag his fellow countrymen's previous fortunes in the English top flight do not provide a promising omen.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / Chelsea FC via Getty Images / EMPICS Sport / REUTERS / Manchester United via Getty Imag / AP

item.title: Thomas Tuchel reveals Chelsea's pitch 'wasn't where we wanted it to be' at the START of the season
item.description: Ahead of his side's London derby against West Ham, also at their home ground, Tuchel claimed the issues began when the club didn't renew the pitch in time at the start of the campaign.

item.title: Tyson Fury could have had a defeat on his record after 'highway robbery' against John McDermott
item.description: Tyson Fury faces Dillian Whyte on Saturday. The Gypsy King heads into the fight as the favourite given he is unbeaten at 31-0-1, but many believe Fury should have lost to John McDermott in 2009.

item.title: Alexandr Dolgopolov slams Andrey Rublev as a 'lying hypocrite' amid Wimbledon row
item.description: The All England Club this week banned Russian and Belarusian players from competing at this year's tournament following the invasion of Ukraine. It means Rublev is barred from SW19 this year.

item.title: Cheslea: Todd Boehly's consortium are 'very confident' they will win the battle to buy the club
item.description: With the deadline for final offers up, there are just days remaining before the future owners at Stamford Bridge are expected to be put forward to the Government and the Premier League.

item.title: Arsenal set for boost ahead of Manchester United clash as Takehiro Tomiyasu returns to training
item.description: The 23-year-old settled very quickly in North London after his summer move from Bologna but has not played for the Gunners since mid-January having been troubled by a calf injury.

item.title: Jack Lisowski fumes after being BANNED from wearing a Ukraine flag at the Snooker World Championship
item.description: Lisowski, 30, who is part-Ukrainian, has sported the flag at previous tournaments and wanted to continue in a show of support for the country amid the Russian invasion there.

item.title: Top Premier League clubs want rules changed on signing overseas under-18s
item.description: ADRIAN KAJUMBA EXCLUSIVE: The issue is understood to have been raised with the Premier League as some of the top six members look for potentially-influential support.

item.title: Fan at Anzac round match is bashed after allegedly yelling during the minute's silence
item.description: A man who allegedly yelled during the minute's silence observed to mark the sacrifices of the Anzacs has been punched at the Bulldogs vs Broncos game in Brisbane on Friday night.

item.title: Thomas Tuchel admits feeling 'very tired' by Chelsea's fixture congestion
item.description: Thomas Tuchel admits the fragility of Chelsea's home form is a concern and he is at a loss to find a solution. Chelsea have taken only 26 points from 15 games at Stamford Bridge in the Premier League.

item.title: Tyson Fury vs Dillian Whyte: Gypsy King loses nearly a STONE for heavyweight title fight
item.description: A slimline Tyson Fury tipped the scales at 264lbs 13oz, dropping nearly a stone, while 'The Body Snatcher' put on 6lbs to come in at 253lbs and 4oz ahead of tomorrow night's fight.

item.title: Mikel Arteta admits to concerns about following Arsene Wenger as Arsenal manager
item.description: Arteta could have been Wenger's immediate successor though was eventually handed the job after Unai Emery and then Freddie Ljungberg, on an interim basis, were first to try and replace him.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / Arsenal FC via Getty Images

item.title: Ealing's Premiership dream is OVER as club withdraw appeal to join the top tier of English rugby
item.description: Ealing's Gallagher Premiership dream is over after they withdrew their appeal to join the top tier of English rugby, meaning the competition will only have 13 teams next season instead.

item.title: Jan Vertonghen urges FIFA to introduce 'stop clock' to prevent 'constant diving and crying'
item.description: Jan Vertonghen has hit out at players 'constantly diving and crying' and urged FIFA to take action by introducing straight red cards for simulation in addition to shorter games with a stop clock.

item.title: Man United boss Ralf Rangnick gives his support to captain Harry Maguire after bomb threat
item.description: Cheshire Police were called to Maguire's home on Thursday following the threat, and specially trained explosive dogs searched the garden and surrounding area.

item.title: Leeds star Adam Forshaw will MISS the rest of the season after fracturing his kneecap in training
item.description: The midfielder has been a key player for the Whites since he returned from injury in October after almost two years out with a chronic hip problem.

item.title: Paul Pogba's Man United career looks to be OVER after calf muscle injury
item.description: The France midfielder, whose contract expires at the end of the season, limped off after just 10 minutes of United's 4-0 defeat to Liverpool on Tuesday night.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / TIM KEETON/Shutterstock / AFP via Getty Images

item.title: Ralf Rangnick says he has NOT spoken to Erik ten Hag following Manchester United appointment
item.description: Ten Hag, who currently manages Dutch champions Ajax, was confirmed as United's new manager for next season on Thursday after agreeing a contract until 2025 worth £9million-a-year.
item.media:credit: Manchester United via Getty Imag / AP

item.title: Jurgen Klopp never doubted Thiago Alcantara's suitability to play for Liverpool
item.description: The Spain international has been in brilliant form in the last couple of weeks, performing superbly against Manchester City in the FA Cup and Manchester United in the league.

item.title: Should heading be banned from women's football? Study claims they have weaker necks than men
item.description: Researchers from the University of Otago in Dunedin, New Zealand, conducted a review of 25 major studies looking into why women suffer more concussion than men in football.

item.title: Arsenal defender Lotte Wubben-Moy targeting success on and off the pitch after signing new deal
item.description: The lifelong Gunners fan rose through the clubs' academy before leaving at the age of 16 to play College football with North Carolina Tar Heels in America.

item.title: Manchester United outcast Eric Bailly makes Instagram plea to start ahead of Harry Maguire
item.description: In Raphael Varane's recent absence, Bailly has seen the likes of Victor Lindelof and Phil Jones start ahead of him, with his last appearance coming in the 3-1 win over Burnley on December 30.
item.media:credit: PA / AFP via Getty Images / Paul Currie/Shutterstock / Manchester United via Getty Imag

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo to RETURN for Man United's clash with Arsenal after tragic death of newborn twin
item.description: The United star revealed on Monday that one of his newborn twins died during birth in a heart-breaking announcement, but is set to return from compassionate leave for the weekend's clash.
item.media:credit: Manchester United via Getty Imag / Getty Images

item.title: Morgan has 'no interest' in the England captaincy and declares himself 'happy' in white-ball role
item.description: The idea that Morgan would be parachuted in at the age of 35, having last played the five-day format more than 10 years ago, always appeared fanciful but he had been touted in some quarters.

item.title: Antonio Conte admits he is 'really surprised' by Christian Eriksen's blistering form for Brentford
item.description: Spurs passed up the opportunity to re-sign the midfielder, who spent seven years in north London, with Conte this week praising Brentford for snapping him up in January.
item.media:credit: Matt Impey/Shutterstock / Andrew Fosker/Shutterstock / Tottenham Hotspur FC via Getty I / Sportimage/PA Images / Getty Images

item.title: Lewis Hamilton declares his interest in helping to buy Chelsea from Roman Abramovich
item.description: The consortium, fronted by Sir Martin Broughton, is majority funded by Philadelphia 76ers co-owners Josh Harris and David Blitzer who also have stakes in Crystal Palace.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / Getty Images for The Met Museum/

item.title: Kremlin CONDEMNS nine-month suspension handed out to Russian Olympic gold medalist Evgeny Rylov
item.description: Hosted by president Vladimir Putin at the Luzhniki Stadium, Rylov was among several Russian athletes present at the rally to show support for the military invasion of Ukraine.

item.title: Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp insists he WILL miss the Merseyside derby if Everton are relegated
item.description: Klopp's quadruple-chasing side will look to keep within one point of Man City in the title race, while the Toffees desperately need three points to survive to see another season in the Premier League.
item.media:credit: EPA / Liverpool FC via Getty Images

item.title: Joseph Parker growing frustrated as Joe Joyce negotiations stall
item.description: Parker 30, hasn't fought since his one-sided points victory over Derek Chisora in December last year, a victory which propelled him closer to the elites of the division once more.

item.title: Erik ten Hag's task laid bare as stat shows Man United players are the WORST for defensive errors
item.description: The mammoth challenge that awaits Erik ten Hag at Manchester United has been laid bare by a shocking defensive statistic. He was confirmed as the club's new manager on Thursday.
item.media:credit: EPA / Paul Currie/Shutterstock / DeFodi Images via Getty Images / Getty Images

item.title: PSG to keep Gianluigi Donnarumma, with Keylor Navas set to depart this summer
item.description: Navas has spent the last three seasons at the Ligue 1 giants, and was the team's undisputed first-choice shot-stopper in his first two campaigns at the club.
item.media:credit: REUTERS / AFP via Getty Images / Getty Images

item.title: Liverpool and Man United legends Kenny Dalglish and Sir Alex Ferguson pose for a picture at Anfield
item.description: The picture, which was taken during Liverpool's 4-0 win over United on Tuesday, shows the former Reds striker standing with Ferguson, Kenny Dalglish and David Gill.

item.title: Jurgen Klinsmann heaps praise on 'fantastic' Christian Pulisic and backs him to only get better
item.description: Klinsmann, who handed Pulisic his national team debut in 2016 during the USA's ultimately unsuccessful 2018 qualifying campaign, said the player had 'matured so much'.

item.title: Man United: Mauricio Pochettino 'shocked by Erik ten Hag's appointment as manager'
item.description: Ten Hag was confirmed as the club's new manager on Thursday morning after agreeing to a three-year deal with the option of an additional year and will take charge at the end of the season.

item.title: Dani Alves claims Barcelona's slow start cost them the chance to challenge Real Madrid this season
item.description: The Catalan giants beat Real Sociedad 1-0 on Thursday to move back into second place in LaLiga. However, they still find themselves 15 points adrift of Real Madrid.
item.media:credit: EPA / Getty Images / Real Madrid via Getty Images

item.title: Kylian Mbappe 'has asked Real Madrid for £83m more than they agreed and Spanish club have refused'
item.description: Real Madrid have reportedly turned down Kylian Mbappe's excessive wage demands, raising doubts over their deal for the forward, who is out of contract at PSG at the end of the season.
item.media:credit: Javier Garcia/Shutterstock / Getty Images / PSG via Getty Images

item.title: Barcelona 'ready to move for Marcus Rashford if Erik ten Hag forces him out of Manchester United'
item.description: Barcelona are reportedly considering a move for Manchester United forward Marcus Rashford this summer, with the England international unlikely to be in Erik ten Hag's Old Trafford plans.

item.title: Giorgio Chiellini 'will end his 17-YEAR stay at Juventus and is set for the MLS'
item.description: ALVISE CAGNAZZO: These will be the last few weeks in Turin - and Italy - for the 37-year-old defender, who is headed for the MLS but it is not yet clear which team will welcome the Euro winner.
item.media:credit: Juventus FC via Getty Images / NurPhoto/PA Images

item.title: Liverpool star Mo Salah admits he 'doesn't know' if he will stay at Anfield
item.description: Mohamed Salah has offered his strongest suggestion yet that he is heading towards the exit door at Liverpool. The Egyptian has developed into one of the best players in the world since joining.

item.title: Wayne Rooney 'REJECTS chance to join Erik ten Hag at Manchester United
item.description: Ajax boss ten Hag was confirmed as the new manager at Old Trafford on Thursday, with his current assistant Mitchell van der Gaag in contention to join the new Red Devils coaching team.

item.title: Man United: Erik ten Hag could be handed a £120million transfer budget to rejuvenate the side
item.description: The 52-year-old was confirmed as the club's new manager on Thursday morning after agreeing to a three-year deal with option of an additional year and will replace interim manager Ralf Rangnick.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / DeFodi Images via Getty Images / PA

item.title: Valencia's Carlos Soler on loving the Premier League as a kid and Copa del Rey
item.description: PETE JENSON IN SPAIN: Soler admits he had plenty of good role models growing up because he spent Saturday and Sunday afternoons as a kid watching the Premier League on Canal Plus.

item.title: Charlie Appleby and William Buick are ready to strike again with Goldspur at Sandown
item.description: Charlie Appleby and William Buick have spent much of the last fortnight mopping up virtually every Classic trial going and GOLDSPUR (Sandown, 3.35) can continue the trend on Friday.

item.title: Robin Goodfellow's racing tips: Best bets for Friday, April 22
item.description: Sportsmail's racing expert Robin Goodfellow delivers his tips for Friday's meetings at Doncaster, Southwell, Perth and Sandown.

item.title: Huddersfield 2-1 Barnsley: Visitors suffer relegation as Terriers continue promotion push
item.description: HUDDERSFIELD 2-0 BARNSLEY: Huddersfield condemned Yorkshire rivals Barnsley to relegation to League One with victory at the John Smith's Stadium.

item.title: Mike Tyson 'had water bottle thrown at him' before punching a fellow passenger on flight to Florida
item.description: Mike Tyson was provoked into punching a passenger on a plane after having a water bottle thrown at him. The former heavyweight champion was flying to Florida when a man became antagonistic.

item.title: St Kilda sneak past GWS Giants as Jack Higgins kicks four in Canberra
item.description: The umpire dissent crackdown reared its head when St Kilda's Daniel McKenzie raised an arm after giving away a free kick, with the 50m penalty resulting in a GWS goal.

item.title: Brisbane come from behind to see off Canterbury as Adam Reynolds helps stage turnaround victory
item.description: It was shaping as a monumental night for the Bulldogs, who brought in Jacob Kiraz and Billy Tsikrikas to debut from after four players caught COVID-19.

item.title: Emilia Romagna Grand Prix: Lewis Hamilton only 18th fastest in practice as Charles Leclerc sets pace
item.description: Mercedes' early-season woes showed few signs of changing with George Russell only 10th, and team-mate Hamilton even further back, seven seconds off Leclerc's pace.

item.title: Tottenham: The six players Antonio Conte is 'targeting' to lead Premier League title charge
item.description: Sportsmail looks at the six players Antonio Conte is targeting - including Christian Eriksen, Kalvin Phillips and Djed Spence - to reinvigorate Spurs ahead of an attempted title tilt next year.
item.media:credit: REUTERS / Getty Images / NurPhoto via Getty Images

item.title: Arsenal are still hopeful they can convince Eddie Nketiah to stay at the club beyond end of season
item.description: ADRIAN KAJUMBA: Striker Nketiah is into the final few months of his current Arsenal deal and the subject of interest from a number of clubs both in the Premier League and abroad.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / Arsenal FC via Getty Images

item.title: Max Verstappen hoping for 'straightforward weekend' in Italy after disastrous start to F1 season
item.description: Reigning Formula One world champion Max Verstappen is desperate for things to go smoothly this weekend after a start to the season that has been plagued by reliability issues.
item.media:credit: Dppi/LiveMedia/Shutterstock / Anadolu Agency via Getty Images

item.title: St Kilda star Jack Hayes hobbles off with suspected ACL injury
item.description: Hayes, a former concreter from South Australia, has made a flying start to life in the AFL, starring on debut against Collingwood after finally getting a chance at the top level.

item.title: F1: Seven reasons to look forward to the Emilia Romagna GP
item.description: Formula One is back in Europe for the first time this season following three highly intriguing races to start the campaign in Bahrain, Saudi Arabia and Australia.
item.media:credit: REUTERS / Getty Images / Formula 1 via Getty Images / AFP via Getty Images

item.title: Hawks coach Sam Mitchell explains his brutal decision to cut Jaeger O'Meara's minutes
item.description: Jaeger O'Meara and fellow experienced gun Tom have been sacrificed by Sam Mitchell for the overall betterment of the team in pursuit of their next premiership.

item.title: Tyson Fury and Dillian Whyte do NOT have rematch clause but challenger promises one if he wins
item.description: Dillian Whyte has confirmed that there is no rematch clause attached to his fight with Tyson Fury but says he will give the Gypsy King one if he does beat him on Saturday night.

item.title: Taylor Walker ESCAPES sanction for veiled dig at Trent Cotchin
item.description: Walker discussed the round five incident in which Cotchin kicked the forward as the pair contested the ball, with the 31-year-old claiming the contact was deliberate.

item.title: UFC: Aussie fighter reveals how a talk with NRL star Andrew Fifita helped him return
item.description: The light heavyweight's three-year stint out of action - owing to a serious knee injury - is the longest any UFC star has been sidelined , beating Dominic Cruz's record by 13 days.

item.title: Junior Paulo reveals commentators and fans have been pronouncing his Samoan surname WRONG
item.description: Ever since bursting on the scene, commentators and fans have pronounced Paulo's surname as 'poor-low', yet the 28-year-old has explained that it should be said differently.

item.title: Idiotic NRL try celebrations will hurt players and they should be stopped
item.description: MIKE COLMAN: Now, the big question is: how long will we have to wait until some player gets seriously injured in an outpouring of idiocy following a try or field goal?

item.title: Burnley's match against Southampton is stopped to allow players observing Ramadan to break fast
item.description: Ramadan sees Muslims around the world partaking in a period of fasting where they do not eat or drink during the daylight hours from dawn until sunset, which occured at 8:26pm on Thursday.

item.title: George Kambosos reveals why he chose boxing over rugby league after making Cronulla junior squad
item.description: Australian lightweight boxing champion George Kambosos Jr has revealed why he chose life in the ring as a teenager over a possible career in rugby league with the Cronulla Sharks.

item.title: Jack Riewoldt reveals he's sent Dustin Martin several messages but has had NO reply
item.description: Richmond Tigers players remain in the dark on when Dustin Martin could return to training with veteran Jack Riewoldt revealing he has messaged the superstar several times
item.media:credit: AFL Photos via Getty Images / Getty Images / Dustin Martin Instagram

item.title: Man United: Erik ten Hag will earn close to £30million at Old Trafford
item.description: Erik Ten Hag was confirmed as United's manager on Wednesday on £9m a year until 2025, and is set to be joined by his Ajax assistant Mitchell van der Gaag when he starts this summer.

item.title: Family of super-fit Aussie cricket star he's STILL fighting for life after emerging from a coma
item.description: Former Aussie cricket player Ryan Campbell has been taken out of an induced coma but remains in a critical condition from the series of heart attacks he suffered in London over a week ago.

item.title: CHRIS WHEELER: Erik ten Hag is Man United's biggest gamble yet
item.description: England's biggest club tried the Chosen One in Moyes and the Special One in Mourinho. They've gone Dutch once before with Van Gaal and went down memory lane with Solskjaer.
item.media:credit: Liverpool FC via Getty Images / PA / Getty Images / Ian Hodgson

item.title: Manchester United rebuild will take years - Old Trafford is where talent goes to die
item.description: CHIEF SPORTS WRITER: Erik Ten Hag's job is not to tinker but to demolish and start again. David de Gea aside, would anyone survive if money was absolutely no object?
item.media:credit: PA / Getty Images / Paul Currie/Shutterstock / Paul Greenwood/Shutterstock

item.title: Bombers legend Matthew Lloyd tells vice-captain Andrew McGrath the side 'lacks honesty'
item.description: It doesn't get more honest than this. Former Bombers champion Matthew Lloyd has slammed the Essendon midfield for 'lacking honesty' and vice-captain Andrew McGrath has taken it on the chin.
item.media:credit: Nine / AFL Photos via Getty Images

item.title: AFL mocked after diving head first into NFTs with Animoica and instantly STUFFING it up
item.description: The AFL has been mercilessly mocked over the launch of its new NFT venture after allowing free-for-all access to its messaging service Discord.

item.title: Bulldogs boss Phil Gould's bizarre Twitter habit sees him change the name of EVERY team in the NRL
item.description: Phil 'Gus' Gould is a highly respected figure in rugby league - but one particular Twitter habit from the Canterbury Bulldogs boss baffles many of his 35,000 plus social media followers.

item.title: Heartbroken son of late West Coast Eagles legend Chris Mainwaring dedicates WAFL debut to his father
item.description: Chris Mainwaring was a two-time premiership-winning West Coast player but tragically died at just 41. Now his son Zac is set to make his senior debut and is dedicating the match to his dad.

item.title: Ex-Cronulla Sharks star with a baby on the way is left a quadriplegic after horror rugby incident
item.description: Former NRL player Nathan Stapleton has been left paralysed from the shoulders down after breaking his neck while playing NSW country rugby union earlier this month.

item.title: Player reaction that shows why the AFL's umpire dissent rule is doing NOTHING to promote respect
item.description: Vision has surfaced of an AFL player openly laughing at an umpire after giving away a free kick for dissent. AFL legend Nick Riewoldt said the vision shows that the crackdown is not working

item.title: Manchester United: How Erik ten Hag can succeed at Old Trafford according to Ajax fans
item.description: ADAM SHERGOLD IN ROTTERDAM: The Ajax fans Sportsmail spoke too ahead of Sunday's Dutch cup final were unanimous that Ten Hag would do well at United.
item.media:credit: AFP via Getty Images / Everton FC via Getty Images / Getty Images / ANP via Getty Images

item.title: Poster boy of Welsh rugby Louis Rees-Zamit says he has recovered from Six Nations setback
item.description: The 21-year-old Gloucester wing soared to prominence but was brought back down to earth after he was released from the Wales squad during the Six Nations.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / CameraSport via Getty Images

item.title: Liverpool's place 'back on the perch' ahead of Manchester United has never looked clearer
item.description: Whatever route you take though from 2013 to Tuesday night's mauling at Anfield. United are at their lowest ebb since 1990 while Liverpool by huge contrast have arguably never looked so good.
item.media:credit: Liverpool FC via Getty Images / PA / Manchester United via Getty Imag / Getty Images

item.title: Bad-mouthed battle of the Brits: Bitter Lewis v Bruno bout set the stage for Fury and Whyte showdown
item.description: JEFF POWELL: You're not a true Brit,' boomed the voice of the United Kingdom's most beloved fighter. 'You're an Uncle Tom,' came the champion's wounding riposte.

item.title: Jamie Redknapp insists Burnley should stick with Mike Jackson after Southampton victory
item.description: Jamie Redknapp believes Burnley should stick with interim manager Mike Jackson after their 2-0 victory over Southampton. Burnley have taken four points out of six under the interim boss.
item.media:credit: Sky Sports / CameraSport via Getty Images / REUTERS

item.title: Hilarious moment Andrew Johns gets distracted by Sharks star Cam McInnes' missing tooth
item.description: Rugby league Immortal Andrew Johns is a huge fan of Sharks hard-man Cam McInnes - and especially his missing front tooth. The pair enjoyed a hilarious exchange on Channel 9 on Thursday.

item.title: Rio Ferdinand relieved Man Utd have 'some sort of direction now' after Erik ten Hag's arrival
item.description: After a disappointing season for United however, Ferdinand did note that Ten Hag must hit the ground running at Old Trafford with regards to recruitment and culture.

item.title: Wayne Rooney urges Man United fans 'to be a little bit patient' with Erik ten Hag
item.description: Erik Ten Hag will succeed Ralf Rangnick, who has been in charge as interim manager, and Wayne Rooney believes that news of Ten Hag is 'positive' for Manchester United and its supporters.

item.title: Jordan De Goey keen to open contract talks with Collingwood after hot start to the season
item.description: Collingwood star Jordan De Goey is reportedly keen to open negotiations with the club over a new deal after a red-hot start to the season that has seen him average 23 disposals and two goals a game.

item.title: Wimbledon ban is 'discrimination,' says Russian world No 8 Andrey Rublev
item.description: Along with world No 2 Daniil Medvedev, Rublev, the world No 8, is a big casualty of the SW19 tournament and he has joined others, including Novak Djokovic, in condemning the decision.

item.title: Harry Maguire insists 'he won't be forced out of Manchester United by some cowardly fan'
item.description: Manchester United captain Harry Maguire was defiant as he reportedly insisted he won't be forced out of the club despite a bomb scare at his Cheshire home following a threatening email.

item.title: Liverpool: Celtic wonderkid Ben Doak confirms his £600k move to Anfield on social media
item.description: Scottish wonderkid Ben Doak has confirmed his move to Liverpool on social media after the club forked out a £600,000 compensation fee to sign him from Celtic.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / SNS Group / SFA / Instagram @bendoak._

item.title: Levante 2-3 Sevilla: Visitors boost Champions League hopes with victory at LaLiga strugglers
item.description: Jesus Corona scored twice and Jules Kounde added a late third as Sevilla boosted their Champions League hopes with victory at Levante.

item.title: ATP to consider ranking freeze to protect Russian players banned from competing at Wimbledon
item.description: One measure that will be discussed in the next week is bringing in a compensatory ranking point scheme along the lines of the system employed during the period of Covid disruption.

item.title: Manchester United: Target Christopher Nkunku 'set to stay at RB Leipzig next season'
item.description: Manchester United's hopes of signing Christopher Nkunku have reportedly taken a hit, with RB Leipzig insisting that the French international will play for them next season.

item.title: The Premier League Hall of Fame almost DOUBLES in size as Paul Scholes leads additions with Drogba
item.description: Patrick Vieira and Wayne Rooney were revealed in March, and are are now joined by a further six including Paul Scholes, Didier Drogba and Sergio Aguero - but with no more from Liverpool.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / Arsenal FC via Getty Images / AFP via Getty Images / Bob Thomas Sports Photography vi

item.title: Former Australia captain Ricky Ponting rejects the chance to become a coach with England
item.description: The ex- Australia captain, 47, is currently in India, where he is the coach of IPL franchise Delhi Capitals and he has ruled himself out of the chance of getting involved with England.

item.title: West Ham: Kurt Zouma to appear in court for kicking a cat the week after the Europa League final
item.description: EXCLUSIVE: Zouma is due to appear at Barkingside Magistrates' Court on May 24 after being prosecuted under the Animal Welfare Act. The Europa League final in Seville is on May 18.
item.media:credit: SNAPCHAT / THE SUN / Getty Images / PA

item.title: Burnley caretaker manager Mike Jackson does not know if he will be in charge for next game
item.description: Burnley caretaker manager Mike Jackson admitted he did not know if he would take charge of Sunday's match against Wolves after guiding the Clarets to a crucial win over Southampton.

item.title: Real Sociedad 0-1 Barcelona: Pierre-Emerick Aubameyang heads in only goal of the game
item.description: PETE JENSON IN SPAIN: If Barcelona win their game in hand on Sunday against Rayo Vallecano they will be all but assured Champions League football again next season.

item.title: IAN HERBERT: Erik ten Hag and Ralf Rangnick could be a dream team at Manchester United
item.description: IAN HERBERT - DEPUTY CHIEF SPORTS WRITER: Erik ten Hag arrives at a club cluttered with executives who are supposed to be driving meaningful change and are plainly not.
item.media:credit: Peter Powell/EPA-EFE/REX / Getty Images / Paul Currie/Shutterstock / ANP via Getty Images / REUTERS

item.title: NRL reporter slams 'journos who make a living out of rubbishing stories' after Kalyn Ponga saga
item.description: A veteran NRL reporter has called out fellow journalists who in his eyes 'make a living out of rubbishing stories' after he was panned for his coverage on Knights superstar Kalyn Ponga.

item.title: Raiders star Elliott Whitehead performs first aid on hurt cyclist - after having PLASTIC SURGERY
item.description: NRL star Elliott Whitehead won't forget events from Tuesday anytime soon - after having plastic surgery on his lip following a head clash at training, he later performed first aid on a cyclist.

item.title: Chelsea sale: Lewis Hamilton and Serena Williams join Sir Martin Broughton's bid to buy club
item.description: According to Sky News, the seven-time Formula One champion and the 23-time Grand Slam winner are prepared to pledge £10million each to the deal.
item.media:credit: REUTERS / Getty Images for The Met Museum/ / AFP via Getty Images / Getty Images

item.title: BRYAN ROBSON - Manchester United: The only way is up for Erik ten Hag - but it's NOT a quick fix
item.description: INSIGHT BY BRYAN ROBSON: This is an opportune moment to reset. Manchester United have had far too many managers in recent years and they need to trust this one to get it right.

item.title: Leeds United: Howard Wilkinson, Tony Dorigo and Gordon Strachan relive title-winning season
item.description: EXCLUSIVE INTERVIEW: Thirty years ago, Howard Wilkinson watched Manchester United lose to Liverpool which meant Leeds were the champions - the last before the Premier League era.
item.media:credit: Popperfoto via Getty Images / Press Association

item.title: Man United player Harry Maguire calls the police after he received a BOMB THREAT targeting his home
item.description: Cheshire police with police dogs were sent to the England star's mansion where he lives with his fiancee Fern Hawkins and their two daughters but searches are reportedly still ongoing.

item.title: Emma Raducanu beats Tamara Korpatsch in three sets in Stuttgart to book a quarter-final spot
item.description: Emma Raducanu will face world No 1 Iga Swiatek on Friday in the quarter-finals of the Porsche Tennis Grand Prix match in Stuttgart after a valiant win against home favourite Tamara Korpatsch.

item.title: MARTIN KEOWN: Arteta trusted Saka, Smith Rowe and Nketiah against Chelsea and Arsenal reaped rewards
item.description: MARTIN KEOWN: I was at Stamford Bridge on Wednesday night and told manager Mikel Arteta afterwards that the academy should be proud of themselves. I'm sure they are.

item.title: Cristiano Ronaldo returns to training with team-mates for first time since death of baby son
item.description: Cristiano Ronaldo has returned to train alongside his team-mates for the first time since he announced the tragic death of his newborn baby son.

item.title: How Newcastle have become the form Premier League team of 2022
item.description: Newcastle's transformation under Eddie Howe has been one of the stories of the Premier League season, with the Magpies climbing up to the giddy heights of 11th place after a 1-0 win over Palace.
item.media:credit: PA / Getty Images / REUTERS / CameraSport via Getty Images

item.title: Burnley 2-0 Southampton: Connor Roberts and Nathan Collins secure vital victory for Clarets
item.description: CHRIS WHEELER AT TURF MOOR: Maybe sacking Sean Dyche was not the worst move after all. Maybe Burnley chairman Alan Pace acted just in time to give his club a chance of staying up.

item.title: Max Verstappen pokes fun at Lewis Hamilton's involvement in Martin Broughton's bid to buy Chelsea
item.description: Arsenal fan Hamilton has been named as part of Sir Martin Broughton's consortium hoping to buy the west London club, pledging millions alongside Serena Williams.

item.title: Jimmy Anderson wicketless on his first appearance since being axed for England's tour of West Indies
item.description: The 39-year-old began with an uncharacteristic blemish when he sent down a huge wide first ball against Gloucestershire, but was soon back to his parsimonious best.

item.title: Ricky Hatton warns Tyson Fury not to 'fight like Rocky Marciano' in Dillian Whyte showdown
item.description: Ricky Hatton has warned Tyson Fury will need to box smarter and not be too gun-ho in his approach if he is to retain his belt in the upcoming world heavyweight title fight with Dillian Whyte.
item.media:credit: Top Rank via Getty Images / Getty Images / Philip Sharkey/TGS Photo/Shutterstock / Action Images via Reuters

item.title: David De Gea 'very excited' that Manchester United have announced Erik ten Hag as new manager
item.description: The Dutchman will be the seventh manager who De Gea - who was a signing under Sir Alex Ferguson in 2011 - has worked with and the Spaniard insisted he was happy the club had got the deal over the line.

item.title: Steven Gerrard is spotted watching Marseille beat Nantes - boss 'scouting Boubacar Kamara'
item.description: Aston Villa will target two central midfielders this summer after boss Steven Gerrard watched Marseille star Boubacar Kamara in action this week.

item.title: Ashley Westwood confirms he has had successful surgery after suffering a horror ankle injury
item.description: WARNING GRAPHIC CONTENT: Ashley Westwood revealed he had successful surgery as he paid tribute to the 'overwhelming' support he has received since his horrific ankle injury.
item.media:credit: CameraSport via Getty Images / AFP via Getty Images / PA / Jed Leicester/Shutterstock / Mark Greenwood/IPS/Shutterstock

item.title: England Cricket: Matt Fisher picks up a back injury six weeks out from first Test vs New Zealand
item.description: Matt Fisher has been hit by another injury set back as those vying for England Test places continue to face disruption. Fisher missed Yorkshire's match against Northamptonshire starting on Thursday

item.title: Man Utd: Erik ten Hag would not be wanted by any of the Premier League's top four, says Carragher
item.description: None of the Premier League's top four sides would swap their current managers for new Manchester United boss Erik ten Hag, says Jamie Carragher.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / EPA / Arfa Griffiths/West Ham United/Shutterstock / Borussia Dortmund via Getty Imag / ANP via Getty Images

item.title: Ronnie O'Sullivan takes a dig at Mark Allen's lifestyle of 'curry, bets and beers'
item.description: Six-time world champion O'Sullivan is himself a fitness fanatic and says running and gym work keep him sane on the snooker treadmill but admits his approach is not best for everyone.

item.title: Man United stars that Erik ten Hag 'thinks ARE worth keeping includes Rashford and van de Beek'
item.description: Incoming Manchester United manager Erik ten Hag has reportedly already chosen the players he thinks 'are worth sticking with' when he arrives at Old Trafford at the end of the season.
item.media:credit: Everton FC via Getty Images / Paul Currie/Shutterstock / Getty Images / Paul Greenwood/Shutterstock / Manchester United via Getty Imag / EPA / Peter Powell/EPA-EFE/REX

item.title: Ricky Hatton opens up on shock return to boxing: 'I've spoken to Tyson Fury about it'
item.description: Hatton retired in 2012 after suffering defeat by Vyacheslav Senchenko but will return to the ring in July. Ahead of his return, he has discussed his struggles with depression.

item.title: Man United Fred hails arrival of 'world class' Erik ten Hag as he breaks silence the on new boss
item.description: Ten Hag was confirmed as Red Devils manager on Thursday, signing a three-year deal with an option for a fourth to become the fifth permanent boss since Sir Alex Ferguson retired in 2013.

item.title: Nice's Flavius Daniliuc is on plenty of Premier League radars ahead of summer transfer window
item.description: TOM COLLOMOSSE: Last summer the Austrian was on the target lists of both Southampton and West Ham and will likely attract more English interest this summer after another impressive campaign.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / NurPhoto via Getty Images

item.title: Man United: Gary Neville says it will take over two years for Erik ten Hag to deliver trophy
item.description: United have gone five years without winning a single trophy and former defender Neville has told the fanbase to expect that wait to continue a little longer as Ten Hag gets to work.

item.title: Gareth Bale 'in talks with DC United over joining them on a free' when his Real Madrid deal expires
item.description: The Washington Post are reporting that the MLS side are in talks with Bale's representatives about joining them on a free in the summer, with each side 'exchanging proposals' over a move.
item.media:credit: Getty Images / Icon Sportswire via Getty Images

item.title: Eddie Howe deserves to win Manager of the Year, insists Newcastle defender Dan Burn
item.description: The former Bournemouth boss took charge of the Toon in November when they were second bottom with only five points. But they are now 11th and closer to the European places than the drop zone.
